metadata.feature_description: Integrate Disqus commenting system for post discussions

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Connectors in Persona Bar
steps.expected: Connectors page should load with list of available connectors
steps.actual: Connectors page loaded successfully showing all available connectors including Disqus

steps.action: Locate Disqus connector in the list
steps.expected: Disqus connector should be visible in the connectors list
steps.actual: Disqus connector is visible with Connect button indicating it is not yet configured

steps.action: Click Connect button for Disqus connector
steps.expected: Configuration dialog should open with required fields
steps.actual: Configuration dialog opened showing Disqus shortname and API Key fields with Cancel and Save buttons

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify post detail page without Disqus configured

steps.action: Navigate to a published post detail page
steps.expected: Post detail page should load with post content
steps.actual: Post detail page loaded successfully showing title, date, tags, content, author info, and social share buttons

steps.expected: Comments section should not be visible when Disqus is not configured
steps.actual: No Disqus comments section is displayed, which is correct behavior when Disqus connector is not configured

observations: Disqus connector requires external Disqus account credentials (shortname and API key) to be configured before comments can be displayed
Code in Detail.ascx.cs shows comments section visibility is controlled by: !IsEditMode && Post.AllowedComments && Post.Published && _disqusManager.HasBeenConfigured
The Disqus integration code exists in Components/Integration/DisqusManager.cs which wraps the Disqus Connector module
Post detail view (Detail.ascx) includes Disqus embed script that only renders when ShowComments is true
Testing actual Disqus commenting functionality requires valid Disqus API credentials which are not available in this test environment
